titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Chinese Political Prisoner Photograph Collection, 1924-1946 EAL.2016.01
titlestmt.author: Haihui Zhang.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:06:09 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection includes small photographs of 104 Chinese political prisoner taken between 1924 and 1946. The names of the prisoners are written on the back in French. Digital reproductions of the photographs are available online.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Chinese Political Prisoner Photograph Collection, 1924-1946, EAL.2016.01, ULS Area Studies, University of Pittsburgh

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Based on the physical condition and handwriting on the back of the photographs, the photos were taken between 1924 and 1946. It is believed that the men depicted were political prisoners from the French concession in Shanghai. During the 1930's and 1940's the Kuomintang (KMT) and the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) experienced a time of collaboration, split, and conflict.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection includes 104 photographs of Chinese political prisoners (all males) taken between 1924 and 1946. Each of the photographs is 2 x 1 inches in size and has information handwritten on the back—usually the French form of the prisoner's name and one or more dates relating to the individual's incarceration.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: A staff member in the ULS East Asian Library discovered these photographs in September 2015 for sale on the Internet. The ULS purchased them in October 2015 from a bookstore in mainland China.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of the photographs are available online.
